content.description: Climb the diagonal hand crack up to a juggy top out.  Hands and fingers in the crack and feet on the slab.  Very classic.
content.location: Located in Wild Raspberry Corner.  These blocks are about 30 feet downhill - and facing - the house-sized boulders.  Can't miss it.  Pick some berries while you're there!

content.description: Start on a good crimp on the face to the left of the arete, and a Gaston crimp just to the left of the arete, move around the arete to a good sidepull and jug and top out
content.location: Looking down from the huge boulder, it will be 100 feet in front of you

content.description: This sit-start problem climbs the obvious angled arete.  Sit, straddling the corner.  You have a very low right foot smear and a low rail for a left heel hook.  Your right hand starts on a slopey crimp and left is on a shallow side pull.  Body tension gets you above your feet to more crimps above (the crux).  Find some good feet, get situated, and top it out.
content.location: Located on the Deadwood Boulder.  If you're standing at the base of the house-sized boulders, face toward Juji Fruit/the pullout in the road.  This boulder is about 100 feet in front of you.

content.description: Start with a high left hand on the arete and a right crimp - and a high right foot.  Slap your way up the arete, working your feet as you go.  Top out the upper point of the pyramid.  Classic moves on incredible rock.
content.location: ​​​​This beautiful triangular slab faces you as you make your way out of the woods to the Hollow boulders.

content.description: Named because you get to it by crossing through a hollow in the woods.  This area has a collection of boulders housing many problems on bulletproof granite.  Many of the problems are in the shade, making this a good spot for those warm months.  If you have any information on this area, please reach out so I can change names/ratings/FA's/etc.
